website_summaries.verdict: This is as close to a perfect digital photo frame as you will find.
pros: Plenty of display modes that are highly customizable
Display is detailed, sharp and large
Possible to send pictures to the frame from anywhere in the world via app
cons: More expensive, but you are paying for a very rich feature set

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to hang horizontally
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Pix Star frames over the years (had purchased around 10 so far). But this new model is designed so poorly it boggles the mind. You can no longer hang these horizontally on the wall. Indeed, they have mounting holes on the back - but they are three inches off center so there is no way to use them!! There is simply no excuse for such poor design defects. The previous generation had perfect mounting holes and screws in the back, perfectly aligned for both vertical and horizontal hanging. This "new" generation seemingly placed the hols in random spots ensuring there is no way to properly hang them! This is just a design flaw plain and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Device already registered, website has no instructions
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a frame, and I can't register it because I get the response: " This ID is already registered". So likely this was somebody else's return, although it still has the cellophane on the screen. However why wouldn't their website provide instruction on what to do? Giving a warning and no tip on how to resolve it is incredibly unhelpful, not to mention there is no contact info. Back it goes for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated for my father. Ever heard of K.I.S.S.?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for elderly father who lives out of state. Way too complicated. I was going to set it up for him in advance and give to him next visit but this unit has way too much other unnecessary stuff like a calculator, weather info, music streaming, etc, incorporated into the basic operation for him to use. If power is interrupted, it returns to a homepage that most seniors couldn’t navigate. It should offer an optional, simplified on/off operation once it’s been setup. Keep It Simple Stupid!
customer_reviews.author: Rabid_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Requires FULL READ and WRITE permission to your ENTIRE Dropbox folder, not just your photos.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to find that this frame requires FULL READ and WRITE access to your ENTIRE Dropbox folder. It may then only access the folders you specify, but if you see the screenshot below, from Dropbox's perspective, you have to give them the whole enchillada. Unacceptable to anyone who uses Dropbox for more than photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Used Frame - beware of seller "pixal"
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this frame and when I went to set it up, it already had someone's family photos on it. I thought I purchased it new, but it definitely was not. Although I was upset it was already used, I decided just to delete their photos and re-set it for my own use. I went to the pix-star website to enter the serial number, but when I did, it said the ID was already registered and wouldn't let me do anything from there. Luckily, the Amazon support team was great and I am able to get my money back, but so frustrating not to get the product that I wanted. Beware of the seller "pixal" - it's not a new product!
customer_reviews.author: Kara Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Extra Extra -  frustration for sale!
customer_reviews.text: Too many times I have sent pictures to this thing and it just doesn't get them. Then I have to log in online and force push the pictures to the device. AND - if my device is in "sleep mode" then before I can push the pictures I first have to unplug air to get it out of sleep mode - because the options for sleep mode are only available in Pix Star's 10 year old video about sleep mode. How nice. Online questions to support are typically responded to "decling" your question and giving you a phone number. And you know how that turns out....
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: I bought 3 of these. 2 of them keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these. 2 of them keep freezing and I have to unplug one of them "EVERY DAY" In order to see my photos I downloaded. If Mfg. replaces one of these I'll take down my one star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Above & Beyond!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this digital frame for my father who lived in a nursing home, and he enjoyed it very much. When he died, we could not find the remote, and needed it to display pictures at his funeral. Sean not only overnighted the remote, but he sent one in every style to be sure we had the right one! His willingness to hep us out at a difficult time puts this company at the top of my people-to-do-business-with list. It's a great frame, and a great company.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Frame!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift to our parents who are somewhat technically challenged. The set up of the frame was super easy. It gives you an email address to send pictures to the frame. You can also go online and set up options such as to have the frame receive and show photos automatically. There is an option to review pictures before releasing them to appear. Very nice all around. The screen is large and has vivid colors. Will buy again for another family member later.
customer_reviews.author: FATCATSRW

customer_reviews.title: Google Photos no longer sync automatically
customer_reviews.text: I bought this frame for my mom as well as my grandmother. In the beginning, it was fantastic; I had connected it to a Google Photos album that I already maintained and the pictures just showed up like magic as I added them. At some point in the last 6 months or so, the automatic update of the album on the Pix Star frames stopped happening and now I have to log into each frame and force an update. Pix Star blames google, it is a 'free' service, so I don't have much leverage, it is certainly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Becker

customer_reviews.title: Great frame, perfect gift that will keep on giving!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my mother, who is technologically challenged, for Christmas. She loves it and says it is the best gift she has ever received, We love it because we do not have to go manually put pictures on it. Once you set up an email address for the frame and set the frame up initially, you can just email pictures to it from anywhere. My only complaint was that it looks like a digital device as opposed to a picture frame. To remedy that, I purchased a nice frame and cut out the back so that I could set the digital frame inside the nice frame. (See picture)
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Fine frame, external limitations
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine digital frame. It has a great display, it's easy to customize, and the tech support is prompt and clear. The only reason for the low two star rating is that the frame can only be used in a limited way with popular external photo web sites including Facebook, Instagram, and Google Photo, because of limitations imposed by these external sites. While this is not the fault of the manufacturer, I do feel the description on Amazon should inform prospective customers of these limitations. Again, other than these limitations, this is a fine product. Minor tip: replace the stock batteries on the remote. It works much better with better batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Marten L. Denboer

customer_reviews.title: Awful!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours trying to get the frame to connect to our home wifi without success. My son, who is a software engineer, attempted to help without success. I tried to contact customer support, which you can only contact by message. They required I have a designated email for the frame, but I couldn't set up an email because the frame would not connect to wifi. I was unable to contact them at all. I am sending this back and wish good luck to anyone brave enough to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: sunlight

customer_reviews.title: Internal Memory is false information
customer_reviews.text: I bought this frame for my parents who live in India, so that I can share their 2 months old grandchild's pics as he grows up. My parents are not tech savvy, so that I can share pics over the air. But it turns out I can only send upto 450 pics and pix-star internal memory is already 99% full. WTF!!! It displays on the ad that it can store upto 15000 pics with internal memory of 4 GB!!! Amazon do something about it!! I feel like I am duped! I should have gone with Nixplay.
customer_reviews.author: Shetal Trehan

customer_reviews.title: It's junk, would prefer to return
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these as a gift for our parents, to push photos to them all of our (soon to be born) daughter. It's a pain in the *** to set up and use. Can't push to multiple frames at a time. (The description is actually false... photos only get pushed from dropbox and other services once a day, not when added.) It also comes with a crummy, easy to lose, remote control rather than a simple touch screen like other digital picture frames. Expected better for the price, suggest looking at other options instead.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Kludgy! Beta at best. Some photos display sideways or up-side down even though they display correctly on my mac. This cannot be fixed remotely; it requires someone standing next to the frame working the menus with the remote control. Requiring a 90-year old to navigate menus is not consistent with the advertising "perfect gift idea for parents and grandparents." ~~~ It says on the box "Instantly receive photos from those you love" but the frame only updates 4 times a day. Not terrible, but certainly not instant. ~~~ Menus on the web site are not at all intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I wanted something that would be very easy for her to use
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research to make sure I was purchasing the correct product. Because my grandmother is elderly and doesn't use technology or electronics much, I wanted something that would be very easy for her to use. All she has to do is plug the frame in and choose her Wifi. The frame does the rest. I love this because I can simply email pictures to the frame and they automatically show up on her frame!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these 1 for me, 1 for my parents.....both of ours stopped working for no reason after about 6 months....then it work sporadically....i would see pics i sent from months ago but none of the current pics i sent would show up...called my internet provider and nothing wrong on their end so it is definitely the FRAME! Really disappointed as we live 1500 miles away from my parents and wanted to share pics of their great grandson but now cannot...they too cannot send us any pics nor can any of the family......and the FRAMES were not cheap $$$ cost quite a bit!
customer_reviews.author: CAF

customer_reviews.title: Terrible technology
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this as a gift for our mom. We ordered another brand as a gift for my mother in law. The other frame arrived first. This one was difficult to set up. You can not combine pictures sent to the different places. The transitions between the pictures were not smooth. The picture quality was not good either. The technology it uses reminded me of early 2000s technology. Very disappointed for the price. We returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Complex Human Interface
customer_reviews.text: After trying to send photos to device, finally realized that it only accepts them as ATTACHMENTS. This requires several extra steps compared to my old Kodak Pulse. Never could get it to accept photos via WiFIi. Not enough options to deal with picture cut-off if importing 16x9 photos. Confusing navigation in Settings.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE GREATEST GIFT for an elderly loved one !!
customer_reviews.text: One of the GREATEST GIFTS for any elderly loved one!!!. I purchased a 10" one for my mother-in-law 5 years ago. It's still going. I purchased my mom a 15" one this past Xmas. She's in her 90's is in LOVE with hers! She even put a chair right in front of it for about 3 weeks when she 1st got it. It is a such a fantastic way for her to watch her grand kids & great grand kids from across the country. All she needs is a Wifi connection. No monthly or annuaI fee! I have recommended it to many of my friends who have elderly parents. Thank you for making our family closer!
customer_reviews.author: McHi Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping in touch!
customer_reviews.text: This picture frame has been awesome to use. I bought it for my mother who is in a skilled nursing center. With the Covid19 lockdown, no one is allowed to visit the facility. I am able to record quick video messages on my phone and email them to her frame to help her not feel abandoned. I am able to log on to the account and see that the frame is on and what photos she is getting to view. It is very easy to email photos as well as load them from the computer when you are logged into your account. Extremely satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bounce

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality lacking, needs more functionality in WiFi connection
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality on this frame was less than impressive. In addition, I bought this to use in my office which uses a secure internet connection that requires entering your username and password but there was no way to do this on this frame so the WiFi connection was useless for me. The remote control was nice and user interface was otherwise really easy. Sending photos to the frame via email was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This digital photo frame deliveries! Emailing to it is extremely easy. The only minor issue i have so far is that when you download photos from your computer (PC in my case), sometimes the photos don't download and then you need to start the process over. Not a big deal just a little inconvenient when you have selected a lot of photos. I have already purchased two in under a month. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy W

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift For Dad
customer_reviews.text: This 15 inch frame has a lot of bells and whistles! I'm setting it up for dad, who is "tech illiterate"! Email photos or videos to the frame's personal address and it gobbles them up and spits them out in any style / presentation you choose. I will update this if I find any problems. One thing I found so far...it doesn't show an apostrophe, like the one in the word "doesn't". Other than that, SO FAR, it's a very cool frame.
customer_reviews.author: Tim in Frisco TX

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but the instructions/support
customer_reviews.text: I really like the digital photo frame but not the customer service...there's no phone number to speak to a live person, you can only e-mail...and that is horrible. I explained in detail and got asked the same questions and never did get any clarification or help. That disappoints me...I like to use the product to the fullest extent and if I have questions...want to be able to speak to someone qualified and who can assist...not send e-mails back and forth. And the price is not cheap
customer_reviews.author: Susan Santangelo

customer_reviews.title: I am on my 5th unit, I give them to everyone in the family!
customer_reviews.text: Each grand parent has one as well as in my office and we have one at home. We don't need to have them touch it or program it as I can remotely control their settings. I also share different albums only to some frames, like taking pictures of the kid's art from daycare/school and add it only to our frame for us instead of not knowing what to do with them. The kids can then see them randomly through all their pictures. We set up one dropbox folder and we just share to it whenever we have a nice picture to share, no email, no SD card, nothing. This system is seriously well done.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBoy

customer_reviews.title: Great For Grandparents With Social Distancing
customer_reviews.text: My family (one child and another due this summer) and my brother’s (just had their first child) family got this for our parents. With everyone social distancing, we can email pictures of our families to our parents. They love it! Pros: Easy to send pictures Via email or the app Can easily manage frame online Can sort pictures online by who uploaded them Features (that I doubt my parents would use) games, weather, and radio. Cons: App seems to do little more than send pictures. I wish the frame could be managed more from the app. Video quality was pretty poor when I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for !!
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother looking for cheaper alternatives. Took me 5 minutes to setup, link to my Google Photos. No hassles. No weird, contorted steps. Bought it for my 84 year old mother. We simply want to "push" her new pictures of grandkids. Email or Google , the syncing works. Sync is quicker with Email, slower with Google Photo folder. But who cares... KUDOS LADIES AND GENTS.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mazzi

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd digital frame in 6 months. The other brands were great, but quit working after a couple months. I’m hoping this one lasts, it’s the most expensive one so far, it had good reviews. I bought the warranty this time. Amazon has a short window of return time on these, they give a partial refund. So far this has worked great, it’s easy to learn how to upload photos from my iPhone. I set a timer like I’ve done in the past so it doesn’t run continuously. I’m going to try the motion detector. I’m keeping my fingers crossed this will be my last frame and it lasts for years, decades.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Young

customer_reviews.title: We’ve been waiting for something like this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest gift. We set it up at our mothers place and she loves it. We just email her pictures and they pop-up within minutes. We can manage all her photos online. All she has to do is turn the frame on and off 💕
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: A great frame, easy to use  Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a frame to send pics to from my ipad. This linked with my wifi, no prob (despite some saying it won’t Link w 5g it linked w mine no prob). When you activate the online acct, just remember that the email address is @mypixstar.com I was also delighted to find I could download the flash drive from my old frame, to internal memory. Furthermore I was able to set automatic on/off times. The only thing I’m struggling with is that it insists on shrinking some of my pics, even though I have selected The expand to size option.
customer_reviews.author: Lady di$

customer_reviews.title: Eureka!  Finally, I've found it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit embarrassing to admit how much I've spent trying to find a digital picture frame that does what I want it do do, and makes it easy to do it. But, FINALLY, I've found one that does everything I want, at a price that I like, and it's large enough to see pictures across the room. I can easily e-mail photos to it, or I can copy pictures to it straight from my computer, or I can copy pictures to it's internal memory from a USB drive. The quality is awesome. The features are impressive. And the price, for the size, is very affordable. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: BGN

customer_reviews.title: Image quality a bit lacking
customer_reviews.text: I did my research and this was supposed to be one of the best on the market. Have to say I was disappointed in the quality of the screen/image. It definitely is nowhere near the quality you'd see on a tablet or laptop screen. I was planning to buy more if I loved it, but I do not. It's ok but for the price I would've expected higher quality screen. 5-10 years ago I'd think the screen looks pretty standard for such a device. But today it seems somewhat outdated. When you look at the quality of screen/image you get with a $49 Kindle Fire, it just seems somewhat disappointing to have your photos shown on this.

customer_reviews.title: Direct SMB access
customer_reviews.text: I got this for it's NAS access capability but found SMB access easier, faster and more reliable. I scripted updates to the frame over the network from my computer and manage the 8GB internal storage with code Pros: Very bright! (I turned it down almost all the way) Crisp! Easy to set up Monitor-style mounting screws! Great for wall mounting. Super customizable slideshows, timers, etc Great wide viewing angle Cons: Unmounts from computer sometimes so had to script remounting it Plays .1 seconds of audio from a video even when set to play no sound Bulky wall plug and really large noise filter on cable near screen
customer_reviews.author: Christofer

customer_reviews.title: Not what it’s cracked up to be.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9” SONY picture frame and wanted a larger one. This wasvrated best on the market. My SONY has a Vivid setting that really does justice to my canon camera images. This Pix-star leaves a lot to be desired. Hue, saturation, and brightness controls cannot be fine-tuned and slideshow cannot be set up for a continuous loop if using an SD card.
customer_reviews.author: RITMISProf

customer_reviews.title: Resolution is only marginal. But the two biggest problems ...
customer_reviews.text: Resolution is only marginal. But the two biggest problems are that it hangs up frequently and the screen goes black, then it will only play the stock demo photos loaded on the frame. A couple of my SD cards have become corrupted and unusable, even after reformatting. I'm not certain that the frame caused this, but I have a couple of other photo frames (different brands) that have run for years and have never had a problem with either one of them. I don't think I'll purchase another pix-star product
customer_reviews.author: Dolores

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best present for my sister in a nursing home when she became a grandma. Getting pictures emailed from her daughter is what she looks forward to every day. The videos were just bonuses but unfortunately the sound stopped working at some point. An email to support and they quickly sent a brand new frame and then configured it with the appropriate email. I get so tired of fighting customer service when I have a problem that it was a relief to see a company do things the right way!
customer_reviews.author: L. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Steer Clear!
customer_reviews.text: To use the frame how it is advertised, you have to register the frame on their website. Their website does not function properly and you are unable to register your frame. Good luck trying to get a help from Pix-Star. There is no phone number on the website or in their user manual. Emails go unanswered as well. To Amazon’s credit, they tried to assist in contacting them, but were unsuccessful. I am returning this item and getting a refund. We will spend the extra $100 and purchase the frame that Oprah recommended. I am somewhat relieved because the frame seemed to be lacking quality.
customer_reviews.author: Go Buckeyes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, Simple and it works!
customer_reviews.text: This photo frame has brought me so much pleasure. My husband set it up and said the directions were simple and well written. We have sent hundreds of photos from my photo file and have not had one problem. I just bought a second one for a gift and plan on giving each of the kids one for Christmas. The enjoyment really is priceless! The photos come in crystal clear. A small remote controller allows you many options but we have only used the "accept" button and we are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Retta

customer_reviews.title: Very Weak WiFi - No Go
customer_reviews.text: I must have a dud. The frame is 10ft away from the router and only gets two bars and it is constantly dropping the connection. I've moved it around the house that has a very robust network. Primary router is an Asus 68R plus an Asus 68R as an AP very close to this frame. The Roku, iPads etc have no issues. I've rebooted the router/AP and the frame with no luck. Very weak wifi on the frame. Wifi on every other device we run is stellar. Maybe another one will do better but this one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: CJL

customer_reviews.title: Company won’t respond to defective product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on September 27 2019 and it stopped working at the beginning of December. Worked for 2 1/2 months. Tried to contact the company but haven’t heard back. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hang horizontally
customer_reviews.text: We like the image quality. If you hope to hang it horizontally (which seems the most logical direction to hang it), they've somehow put the hanging hole a few inches off center, so it's quite tricky to do! Very odd!!! Ours also arrived with something disconnected inside of it, so as we move it, you hear something sliding around inside. It doesn't seem to affect the image quality, but I'm worried that for this money, something will suddenly be wrong. It was a gift to my parents though, so I had to leave it with them in this state. Hoping it'll still last many years--fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Faberella

customer_reviews.title: So much in a frame. Very user friendly!  Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This little frame is so great!! Was hubby birthday present. He loves looking at the pictures changing over time, adding pictures easily thru it’s own email address, and getting the weather. I love the pictures but I really love listening to the world radio stations. There are so many available in so many countries. France is my favorite. What a great option!!! I’m going to buy one again for my parents so we can directly send pix to them without them having to do anything.
customer_reviews.author: S L

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom and she absolutely loves it. My kids and I can easily upload pictures to it from anywhere in the world and my mother can sit and watch the ever expanding show for hours. The only negative is that the uploads from my cloud file are sometimes difficult to do with multiple photos; but uploading shots directly from my iPhone 10 photo library is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: George LeRoy

customer_reviews.title: Pix-star 15 inch
customer_reviews.text: Came on time, well packaged and worked straight out of box. Had bought a nix-play, but after a week on no help with tech tech support trying to get a RMA number because it had bad pixals, finally after calling every day, called my charge card company and 2 hours later got the RMA. So ordered the Pix-star. So glad I did, the photos are great, was so easy to set up and use. Love getting photo's straight onto my frame from my family. only one area I wish they could make possible and that is to get my photos, from messages to my frame,. Other than that I would give it 10 stars.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl kenney

customer_reviews.title: Useless Product - Junk it and come up with something useful
customer_reviews.text: This product is not ready for prime time. Honestly, I think it is a piece of junk. I bought for this for my neighbor who wanted me to help her set it up. I had to use my windows networking knowledge to get the google fotos to show on the device. I’m 100% sure it’s going to end up in the trash. Bad instructions, bad design, horrible product all around!
customer_reviews.author: P. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great Frame, easy for Grandma with Family far away.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this frame. Purchased for my mother due to the large size and the ability for kids and grandkids to be able to send photo directly to her from across the country. Overall the image looks great and it provides a variety of means to submit photos very easily to frame, with no needed interaction from my mother. I can access the frame via the internet to help change photos if she needs help. Only complaint is the cheap looking black frame around it. Would be much nicer if it had a better quality frame rather than looking like another computer monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Nance

customer_reviews.title: Most features, can be set up for a non-technical user
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother, at the suggestion of my sister. After researching different versions, I chose this one because it plays short videos, and there is an on-line interface for trouble-shooting. Pictures can be added directly from emails, or you can set the machine to need approval before pictures are added. The entire family sent birthday greetings to Mom via the picture frame and she loved it. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift for long-distance relatives!
customer_reviews.text: Easy and fast to set up. Makes a great gift for our relatives who spend winter in Florida. Great way to keep them up to date on their grandkids and great-grandkids! I was able to send several photos in each email and they arrived onto the platform almost immediately. I set it all up for the grandparents before giving it to them so all they have to do is plug it in and connect to their WiFi in Florida. Lots of customizable options on the frame. Great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are a military family with 3 young kids. We bought 3 of these to keep the grandparents (who aren't on social medial) up-to-date with pictures. They LOVE these frames and I love how easy it is to send pictures. I would HIGHLY recommend this product to anyone who has internet.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Frame hit all of my goals
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly versatile frame when it comes to sources to display photos from. I bought it due to it's DLNA capabilities, but you can also email photos to it, use a SD card or USB, Samba source, RSS, etc. Option to display single photo, or four or five photo collage. Display is perfectly adequate for it's intended purpose, especially since JPEGs tend to be 72 dpi and not super high resolution. Tons of other features also, such as weather, calendar, clock, etc., but I don't find them especially useful since it's too small to really view across the room. Very pleased with purchase and have yet to explore all of it's features.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Pergrem

customer_reviews.title: Parents love it.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fanatic product. I have it set up in my parents house and just email photos to it constantly. If the wifi goes out it loses connection and does not automatically reconnect. You have to personally go through the reconnection process manually. Easy to do but not for my elderly parents. I was able to walk my father through the reconnection procedure over the phone but it was a process. If I was there in person it would take 5 minutes. Wish it would reconnect to wifi like a cell phone does.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Helping a family member with dementia remember.
customer_reviews.text: We purchase a 15" PixStar frame to help a family member with cognitive issues remember family, friends and places. We had some issues with the frame displaying pictures properly for our family member so we contacted PixStar support. Arnaud replied to me within one day with a few questions which I promptly answered. Arnaud reviewed my reply and indicated that the frame should be swapped. Arnaud arranged the replacement and transferred our photo's to the new frame. Over a period or seven days we could sharing memories with our family member once again. Thank you Arnaud and PixStar for all of your help and support. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Seacoast

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2. Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of them for Mother's Day gifts for my mother and my boyfriend's mother. The shipping was insanely fast. Since my mother isn't tech savvy, I set it up for her. The process was easy and seamless. I live 1200 miles away from my mom and he's about 400 miles from his mom. So these were the most appropriate gifts. I think they'll both love them. I may buy one for my desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Handicap son LOVES IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture and so easy to set up. Bought this for our handicap son for his birthday. He cant work it as far as adding pictures but that was a given. We bought it for his brothers sisters aunts uncles... to send him pictures because he loves seeing them. It's so easy to work. Just email the photo and it shows up . Just that simple. He gets so happy when a new photo appears.. worth every penny and more to see him smile!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John N.

customer_reviews.title: Received a Used Item
customer_reviews.text: Received a used item. It appeared to be ok BUT, when I tried to register it, I could not because the item had been registered before and had an email address already associated with it. From my initial impression, this thing is overly complex, saying it is great for seniors but in reality, the documentation is almost non-existent and when they show various modes, they say, if you dont know what this is, then just skip it. I dont care for that attitude. why not tell us how to use it. It seems that everything has to go via Pix-Star. I wish you could just run it off your own network etc...
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my in-laws. They have 33 grandchildren and 6 great-grandchildren, 2 of which we born since we set the frame up. Everyone can send pictures to the frame easily by just simply sending it as an email. We have the frame set up to automatically accept the pictures but you can set it up so that the pictures have to be approved first. The frame rotates thru the pictures at a good speed. It’s so much nicer than showing them pictures on our phones or sending them so that they have to go to the computer to view them. We have this set up in the living room where they sit most often.
customer_reviews.author: junebug624

customer_reviews.title: I can't recommend it since it can't connect to services
customer_reviews.text: Parent in hospice and it wouldn't connect to wifi. It worked when I tethered it to phone but that isn't a long term solution. Took it to other parents home and it wouldn't connect to wifi there either. This product really let me down, I can't recommend it since it can't connect to services. I gave it two stars since the picture quality appears good. It may work offline fine but that's not the reason I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: kh

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this and want one for myself now!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandma who recently went to a nursing home. All of us cousins have been sending pictures to it almost daily. It works like a charm! Set up was easy. I have it set to turn on at 7:30 am and off at 7:30pm. That way my grandma who has a bit of demensia does not have to touch it at all. I followed someone else’s suggestion and put the digital photo frame in a shadow box frame and hung it on the wall. That way my Grandma won’t b tempted to mess with it. She loves it and sits in her recliner and watches her photo frame instead of the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Mistee

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my parent 60th anniversary July 2018, but less than a year as of last week it just quit. Tried everything to get it come back on no luck. Very disappointed going to contact manufacturer since it has 2 yr warranty but very disappointed it didn't even last a year.
customer_reviews.author: William Couts

customer_reviews.title: Mom Approved!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I wanted to do something different this year for our moms for Mother’s Day. Via an ad for something similar on Instagram, we stumbled upon the digital frame concept. I researched a variety of similar products before deciding on this one. They were a huge hit and both of our moms loved gazing at all the photos of family and life events that I pre-loaded onto the frames before gifting them. Setup was extremely simple and straight forward. My only complaint is that I wish the screen was a touch screen. I’m also not a huge fan of the app. However, I love, love, love the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea, especially for parents and significant others
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to make sure I got good use out of this before reviewing. I can confidently say, this frame is here to stay in my bedroom. It has a whole line of helpful functionalities (such as turning on when someone is around etc.) It is aesthetically very pleasing and just the right size to not become a distraction. It's a wonderful conversation-starter too for when there is not much to say and a random old photo comes up on it. The remote works well and I use the hanging hole/slot at the back to display it. The power cable is not obtrusive or limiting. All in all, a great purchase and would make a wonderful gift.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: With 5 grandkids living hundreds of miles away I decided to buy this frame mostly because the kids can just email pics to my special email address and they start displaying within minutes. My whole family sends their pics now instead of texting or printing them out. We love this frame and will probably buy a few for Christmas presents this year. Setup was super easy and the screen display is great. We set ours up in the kitchen and it’s a great conversation piece when friends are over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh+
customer_reviews.text: Motion detection doesn’t work. Company is sending another frame so we will see. Quality is great. Linked FB photos (about 5000) and I had to keep my phone screen on otherwise it kept failing. It took about 3 hours but then I unlinked it to my fb account and just sent new ones through app. I also bought a sandisk usb thing that takes photos right from my iPhone onto a usb that I just plug I to the frame. Then I can keep it off WiFi. Video quality stinks and it slows it down but all in all (if the new ones motion detection works) I’d recommend it. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Love this Digital Photo Frame!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother-in-law, who is in a nursing home. This was super simple to set up and I love that we can control it remotely from the internet. We and other family can email photos to this frame to change the display whenever we want. You can add music to play with the photos by adding an SD card. This will make a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: BuckeyeBaby

customer_reviews.title: My 96 year old mother loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mom three years ago when it was selling for $190,and have never looked back. She gets hours of enjoyment from it each day. It is super easy for friends and relatives to send pics to the frame's email address. The 800x600 resolution is fine for her purposes--few people will be looking for outstanding detail on a frame this size, and few of the pictures people send would benefit from a higher resolution. The one caveat I have is that if you link the frame to somebody's Internet photo account (Instagram, Twitter, etc.) your frame may be flooded with photos if they are the type who upload everything they shoot without regard to quality or quantity.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Leemon

customer_reviews.title: First one dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a present for my daughter as we already own one and that one works great. This one had to be sent back as it had a bad spot on the bottom left corner and we tried to use it anyway but tried to load 2gb of pictures by USB and it took over 10 hours to load that small amount. Plus once it was loaded it locked up constantly so I sent it back for a replacement
customer_reviews.author: James Michael Ashburn

customer_reviews.title: Very enjoyable to watch.
customer_reviews.text: Given to my mother in assisted living. I was hoping it would keep her mind busy with pictures of the kids, grandkids, and great grandkids. Very easy to set up, posts the pictures automatically, and motion detection is a great thing, doesn’t disturb her if she is resting. Her and her friends spend hours watching all the pictures. Has several settings as to how fast the pictures scroll, so with it on a slow (15 seconds per picture) she is able to really look at them. I have all the kids, grandkids sending pictures regularly, so she can see how they are all growing, and what they are up to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for elder parents
customer_reviews.text: It's great. We went on vacation and were emailing the frame all our pictures for my parents to watch. They loved it. The grandkids send pictures to it too. Easy to set up and my elder parents don't have to do a single thing. There's a motion sensor on it too so it turns on when they enter the room. Works great. Filled with extras but those are just too much for my parents to operate (internet radio, viewing options...). They are happy with just seeing the pictures appear in the frame.
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long distance grandparents
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this product. We travel around and I bought this for my mom. Anytime I take a pic of the kids, I send it from my phone to the email address of her frame. Next day, she gets it on her frame and it's added to the rotation of pics already there. Because they rotate on the frame, I don't worry if it's a great pic. We've also sent gifs. She says this is the best present I've ever bought her. It's basically all the photos I would have sent her on her phone, but now larger and displayed in her home.
customer_reviews.author: AJM

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Great Service
customer_reviews.text: My (adult) brothers and I purchased this as a gift for our Mother so we can all email updated family pictures to her "on the fly" this past Mother's Day. It was one of the easiest pieces of technology I have ever set up. My 70 year old Mom has no problem with it, even the remote. The pictures are bright, clear and vibrant. She did lose her online login info - we contacted Tech Support at Pix-Star, who responded within 24 hours and had our issue resolved immediately. Would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Breslin

customer_reviews.title: So far good, but old batteries included.
customer_reviews.text: The frame replaced the nix frame that i returned as you had to do all sorts of resizing of photos. I love this frame compared to the nix as it was pretty straight forward. The only issue i had was the batteries that were included were bad. The outside was sticky and the print on it leaked all over my fingers. To me thats a bit of an issue especially if a younger child was tasked to set this up as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Patryk

customer_reviews.title: Just AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: The bad - picture quality is not great, its not bad but not great. Ok now that thats out of the way this frame is friggin awesome. I send everything to it and find myself looking at the frame all the time. Its so easy to just email the pic to the frame. A must have for parents.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Carparelli

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Seems defective....use to play all the folders, now it only plays the first 2. I bought a different brand prior & loved it, but the larger size was more expensive than this, so went with this, but this is not as easy to operate. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: jss

customer_reviews.title: Take my money the frame is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this 2 times and it has been the perfect gift for both people. They get to setup their own email address for the frame and Send the email address to anyone they want to send pictures to. They instantly get sent to the frame WITHOUT having to use a USB or card to upload. The frame chimes when new pictures come in ( if you set that up ) and my family is delighted by all the new pictures we are alway sending!!!! This is the best gift for family you don’t always see! I love this frame and so did the people I gave them to!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for grandparents!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my parents. They aren't on social media so we got this so we can all send them pictures of the grandkids. Super easy setup, they don't have to do anything it, pictures show up automatically after being emailed to it, and we can manage it remotely from our own home if they want the settings adjusted. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great frame, but Shutterfly no longer supports it
customer_reviews.text: We have had four of these frames at multiple locations for years and loved the ability to stream photos through our Shutterfly account. Unfortunately, Shutterfly decided to no longer support Pix-Star, and a reply from Shutterfly customer service did not provide any reason or if they will reverse their decision. Hopefully there will be enough feedback to them that they decide re-start supporting these frames. Regardless, the frames have a great display and still allow for easy sharing from multiple other recommended photo services (e.g. SmugMug, flickr, 23snaps, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it works nicely and displays crisp
customer_reviews.text: Two major shortcomings: First, the interface is not nearly as intuitive as it could have been. I bought this for my elderly but savvy mother and quickly realized that she would find it difficult to use the remote to select specific albums to view. Instead I set it up to play all photos by default which requires no intervention. Second shortcoming, it seems to play only video clips that are sent as email attachments, not clips uploaded to the Pix-Star web site. Other than that it works nicely and displays crisp, colorful images.
customer_reviews.author: bellasson

customer_reviews.title: Great for low vision and non tech grandparents
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom who has macular degeneration. It’s awesome for many reasons: (1) it’s got a nice big bright screen (2) she doesn’t have to do anything (3) I can set it to change pictures whenever she likes - we found once every 6 hours was perfect for her (4) I can add pictures remotely (5) other family members can add pictures remotely (6) because they are digital pictures I can edit them to be black and white for better contrast. One of the best gifts I could have gotten her. She LOVES it. Glad I bought the 15”.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nursing homes resident loves it
customer_reviews.text: The frame is great! Follow the directions and it works as advertised. VERY cool that we can set this up for our elderly mom and she gets almost real time pictures from all her kids and grandkids. Videos play and I can control it remotely which is awesome. Quality of the pictures and video is good - not great but good. We have it hooked up to wifi for a good connection so it's virtually hands-off. Well worth the money if your looking to keep someone in the loop that's cannot use technology. Mom LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: SJB

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my GOSH! We love this thing!! We bought it after experiencing one at a family member's home. They've had it for about a year now and absolutely raved about it. "Easy to use, no contract." This would have been perfect for both sets of our parents/grandparents as it would have allowed them to enjoy photos easily. I could have loaded it up with scans of old family photos from the comfort of my own home. The grandkids could have loaded it up with current pictures from their phones. We bought the larger frame so we could easily enjoy the photos from any where in the room. So well worth the cost!!
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great idea
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this frame for my elderly mother for over 2 years now. It has been a wonderful item for her. All of the family members can email in photos that will start appearing on the frame. We can set the options for the slide show from our own homes using the website. This was something she enjoyed watching immediately following her hip fracture surgery when she really wasn't able to concentrate on much else. She continues to watch in now and family members have submitted over 500 photos.
customer_reviews.author: Davis Senior

customer_reviews.title: Multiple frames won't sync.
customer_reviews.text: The frame is great. The images are crisp. But, the software for two frame operation is lacking. I bought the second frame for our vacation home based on the representation that you could view all of your pictures on both frames. But I can't get the pictures to display on both frames. The help desk was no help. I have to send each picture separately to both frames contra the representation in the product description. It was tedious trying to get it to work and then find out it just won't display one picture sent to one frame on the other frame. I may be missing something, but I couldn't get it to work and they couldn't help me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gadget, but poor image quality. Would not buy it.ry poor image quality/resolution.
customer_reviews.text: Loads pictures OK through the Internet, and has good motion detection. Screen resolution is relatively miserable and completely negates any value the rest of the unit. The whole purpose is to have nice, clear, sharp pictures and this frame fails miserably in that endeavor.I would not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Andra Marino

customer_reviews.title: Support not very good
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised but apparently, no way to delete pictures more than one-at-a-time. We wanted to give this frame to another family member after my mother passed away. I reached out to support to ask how to delete previous pictures. Initially, they sent instructions which were apparently for a different frame as they did not match this frame at all. I replied with pictures of the menu's on this screen and despite 3 repeat inquiries, I have not heard back. It seems that the only way to delete the more than 800 photos on the frame is one at a time and support doesn't have the courage to admit the limit on their product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cook

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for product...0 stars for Amazon 😡😡
customer_reviews.text: So this frame is really nice and works as advertised. So the frame is an easy 5 stars while Amazon gets 0 stars!!! The frame I received had clearly been returned by someone else because when I went to register the frame it said that serial number had already been registered 😡😡😡 Shame on you Amazon for reselling a used product like this!!! However, Pix-Star customer service was OUTSTANDING and allowed me to re-register it to myself in a very timely manner!! Excellent gift for my parents!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this!
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great but not a fit for elderly people who don't have help operating. Got for mother to send pictures from afar but it turns out it takes a bunch of complicated steps to receive photos that my 84 year old mother would never be able to navigate without help. Was hoping for something that could be on wifi that could basically be operated from afar. However, once the pictures are on there, it is great. The technology is just super outdated.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte Malessa

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the money! Awesome frame. Can do it all!
customer_reviews.text: I love this frame! It’s the perfect size. Not too big or too small. I love the ease of sending photos to the frame through the mobile app and that you can also add photos from other online media like FB or Dropbox etc. It’s cool how it comes on and turns off every day at a certain time too and that you can program it to do this for you. It’s got soo many cool features I just haven’t had time to explore them all!
customer_reviews.author: GeorGie D.

customer_reviews.title: Killer grandparent frame
customer_reviews.text: This is like sending photos to your smartphone. HOWEVER.. it is not browser based so if the GrandParents have WiFi that needs a second user/password.. you are out of luck. I gave up.. bought a Verizon WiFi Hub and just attached it. COOL Idea... adding browser sounds like it takes the automation out of the solutiion.. so excluded.. Pretty slick USer interface for the manager. And easy for the grand kids to upload.
customer_reviews.author: SWatty

customer_reviews.title: Sporadic functionality, may want to consider another brand if you have multiple sources of pictures
customer_reviews.text: When this works, it is great. But it has trouble getting email from some of the people who try to send pictures. Nothing would ever show up from my wife’s iPhone or AOL address. Just never show up. Triple checked address but just would not accept pics. Even tried forwarding. Spent a week going back and forth with Pix Star support but they were no help at all. Started shouting at me, I guess in frustration. Pretty much useless to me if I can’t receive pics from family and friends. Will put away and try another brand. Such a waste. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Let Me Drive

customer_reviews.title: Register the device
customer_reviews.text: When I received the device, it was already registered to someone else. Therefore, I could not register a mypix-star account and create an email. Very disappointing for a device that is expensive and supposed to be "easy to use". The seller must have been registered to this device already, and did not care that it would not work for the buyer. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Byer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love our Pixstar frame. It is easy to use. Our daughter in law surprises us by sending new pictures of the grand kids. We'll be watching the frame and go is that a new one? The videos are fun to watch, almost like being there. We also have Ave a Nixplay frame. The picture quality is better on the Nixplay but the Pixstar is easier to use. Going to by one for my parents so the grandkids can send pictures of the great grandkids to them.
customer_reviews.author: Wishing

customer_reviews.title: Locks Up reading SD Cards, won't read USB at all
customer_reviews.text: Just received this unit for a gift. After sorting through the clunky interface, I finally managed to get it to do the most basic thing....read and display my picture files from an SD card (USB never would read at all). However, every time I got the slideshow going, it would lock up and the unit would have to be powered down and reset. This unit is now in the dumpster bin and my life is much better off without it. Would NOT recommend this unit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Desertrose2

customer_reviews.title: Pixels out on screen and anemic color
customer_reviews.text: Device arrived with pixels out on the screen. This is near the top, so it's obvious on just about any picture with a face, sky, or plain background there. The Pix-Star 10" frame is expensive for a frame of this size with only 800x600 resolution, so I expected better. Not only are the missing pixels a quality issue, but the color is anemic. I'm a photographer and have color calibrated monitors, but the frame shows these pictures as lifeless, unsaturated and green-cast pictures. If there has to be a color problem, it would have been better if the frame biased to the red so the faces wouldn't look like they're sick.
customer_reviews.author: DZee

customer_reviews.title: Great picture display
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece for wedding bridal shower- she loaded pictures of family and friends. Displayed those on the frame during the wedding dinner and dance. Was such a big hit. Everyone loved it. And many sat to watch the pictures scroll by. I have one if these frames myself. The quality of picture is great. And so many features of display options. You can’t go wrong with the putchase of this frame
customer_reviews.author: Rena M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mother’s Day gift..
customer_reviews.text: Easy to share this gift with family so others can upload memories from their phone for mom to see new pictures all these years later! Great customer service and a good gift that keeps on giving! set it up and load it up with memories from years past for family to see.
customer_reviews.author: C. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Very cool digital picture!
customer_reviews.text: Love my frame! My daughter gave it to me for Christmas! She just became United States Marine and headed to Okinawa, Japan! Can't wait to see new pictures from Japan! Btw she's already sent pictures to my frame! It was cool to see I had a notification of the pictures on my frame. I approved them and they started scrolling through! Great frame! App is lame! Gotta use computer to upload photos from your devices! Otherwise I'm totally digging my frame!!
customer_reviews.author: Goonie Mom

customer_reviews.title: doen't last. Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: **I'm revising my initial review from one to four stars after talking with the manufacturer. they are replacing the item. Still frustrating this happened but I'm thankful it was easily resolved. after less than a year of use this frame has died. it will not connect to the internet anymore. we try to reset the connection but it just freezes and nothing happens. We've looked for a factory reset button but cannot find one. very disappointing b/c we liked it otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: It’s best to take picture horizontally to fill the screen.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much. I gave it as gifts. I ordered a larger one, and customer service was able to move all my pictures from one screen to the next. I’ve had sever questions I couldn’t figure out, and my friend Arnaud ALWAYS comes to my rescue. The costumer service is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan K.

product_meta.title: Pix-Star 10 Inch Wi-Fi Cloud Digital Picture Frame with IPS high resolution display, Email, iPhone iOS and Android app, DLNA and Motion Sensor (Black)
product_meta.description: Size:10 InchThe newest member of the Pix-Star family, this 10 Inch Wi-Fi frame doubles the internal storage to 8 GB (30, 000 photos) and has an incredible 1024x768 pixel IPS display, Brightness: 300 cd/m2 (700:1). Say hello to your new go to gift. Perfect for grandma and the whole family!
feature_bullets: Amazing high resolution photo and video viewing experience on a 9. 7 inch (24. 6 cm) IPS display, 1024x768 pixels, 4: 3 ratio. Easily manage the frame remotely and connect up to 25 frames from one single online account, completely FREE.

Easy set-up: Wi-Fi enabled (2. 4 GHz only, 5 GHz network not supported). Set up in a couple of minutes. 8GB internal memory (around 30, 000 pictures), supports USB stick, SDHC and SDXC cards. Motion sensor automatically turns on/off the screen when you enter and exit the room.

Video and photo sharing by email or via the Pix-Star app (iOS and Android) on your smartphone. The perfect gift to share pictures instantly with your loved ones around the world. Remotely view and manage the photos on your connected frames using the Pix-Star website account at no extra charge with no hidden fees, ever.

It goes both ways! Send pictures from your frame to an individual or several email addresses directly from the frame.  Friends and family can share photos to and from the Pix-Star Wi-Fi frame from anywhere in the world.
Display your social media photos by accessing online photos from Facebook, Instagram, Dropbox, one drive, Flickr, Google Drive, Google Photos, 23Snaps and more.
Receive daily weather forecasts for countries and cities of your choice. Lifetime support and extended 2-year limited included.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,235 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
